docs.title: Welcome to My Documentation
docs.text: This is a sample documentation site built with MkDocs and deployed to GitHub Pages. Please note, this does not have any real content, this is just for demo purposes!

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• 📚 Clean and simple documentation
  • 🎨 Material Design theme
  • 🚀 Automatically deployed to GitHub Pages
  • 🔍 Full-text search
  • 📱 Mobile-friendly

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Check out the Getting Started guide to learn how to use this documentation.

docs.title: Project Layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    getting-started.md  # Getting started guide.
    about.md  # About page.

docs.title: About
docs.text:
This is a sample documentation project that demonstrates how to:

  1. Set up MkDocs with Material theme
  2. Create and organize documentation
  3. Deploy to GitHub Pages automatically

docs.title: Why MkDocs?
docs.text:
MkDocs is an excellent static site generator that's specifically designed for project documentation. It offers:

  • Fast and lightweight
  • Built-in search functionality
  • Easy-to-write Markdown syntax
  • Multiple themes available
  • Simple configuration
  • Python-based

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: This guide will help you get started with MkDocs and show you how to create and deploy your own documentation.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Install MkDocs and the Material theme: 

    pip install mkdocs-material

  2. Clone this repository: 

    git clone <your-repository-url>
cd <repository-name>

docs.title: Local Development
docs.text:
1. Start the live-reloading docs server: 

    mkdocs serve

  2. Open your browser and visit http://127.0.0.1:8000/

  3. Edit the documentation files in the docs/ directory. The browser will automatically reload to preview your changes.

docs.title: Project Structure
docs.text:
• mkdocs.yml - Configuration file
  • docs/ - Documentation files
    • index.md - Homepage
    • getting-started.md - This guide
    • about.md - About page

docs.title: Writing Documentation
docs.text: MkDocs uses Markdown syntax. Here are some examples:

docs.title: Headers
docs.text:
# H1 Header
## H2 Header
### H3 Header

docs.title: Deployment
docs.text: The documentation is automatically deployed to GitHub Pages when you push to the main branch. The deployment is handled by GitHub Actions.
